Dear Shawn Knodel:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the WOC area manager Shay Mavis at 269-243-2725.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Lonia Perry Calloway, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206 Staff qualifications; volunteer,
Section contractors on central registry
Description (2) A staff member must be of responsible character and suitable
and able to meet the needs of children and families served by the
agency.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation.
Type
Allegation On 6/15/2025 Youth A attacked Staff 1 by punching at, spitting on,
and hitting Staff 1 in the face with an electronic device. Youth A
had a grip on Staff 1 and another staff intervened in an attempt to
try free Staff 1. Staff 1 tried to free herself and hit Youth A in the
head.
Interviews:
Investigation On 6/26/2025 I spoke with Program Director (PD) about this
complaint by telephone. PD did not witness the incident. Staff 1
telephoned her and reported the incident. PD said she went to the
independent living (IL) house to address the matter. PD did not
speak with Youth A about the incident. When she arrived onsite
the police were there; the police took Youth A to the Genesse
County Juvenile Justice Center.
PD reported Quality Representative was conducting an
investigation of the incident. She reported there is an incident
report and video footage, and she reviewed both. She reported
from what she observed in the video footage, it showed Youth A
hit Staff 1 in the face and Staff 3 got in between Youth A and Staff
1 to stop the attack. PD reported she was informed by Staff 3
that Youth A had a good hold on Staff 1, so Staff 3 was trying to
separate the two. I asked PD from her view of the video footage
whether she observed any deliberate hitting or striking by Staff 1
onto Youth A; or if any such actions appeared accidentally. PD
2

reported from what she could see, and make out from the video
footage, it appeared that Staff 1 was trying to free herself from
Youth A’s grip.
PD reported Staff 1 has been with the agency a number of years.
She reported the Human Resource Director can provide me with
information related to Staff 1 ‘s date of hire and whether Staff 1
has any previous disciplinary actions.
On 6/30/2025, I interviewed Quality Representative (QR) by
telephone about the allegations. QR reported conducting an
investigation of the incident and viewing the video footage of the
incident. She stated from the video footage she saw Staff 1
standing with her arms folded and then Youth A attacking Staff 1.
QR reported that Staff 1 put her hands up to keep Youth A from
hitting her again, but Youth A latched on to Staff 1’s breast. QR
did not clarify whether she observed the prior act from the video or
whether Staff 1 reported that. QR reported she could not see from
the video footage Staff 1 hitting Youth A, but Staff 1 told her she
hit Youth A on the top of the head, thinking that would cause
Youth A to let her go. QR said Staff 1 showed her how she hit
Youth A on the head, which was with the hand and not a hard
action. QR reported that according to her interview with the
youths who were on the scene, Youth A was beating Staff 1 up.
QR reported it appeared that Staff 1 took a beating before she
tried to do something to free herself; and Staff 3 could not free
her. QR reported being unaware as to whether Youth A reported
being hit or having any bruises. QR said, Staff 1 disclosed verbally
and in writing to having bruises on her face and breast.
QR reported the protocol for incidents like this (attacks or
assaults) is to call for assistance. QR said Staff 1 did that. QR
reported staff are also to remove themself from the situation and
call the police. QR reported Staff 3 came to assist Staff 1 in
getting free to leave; and another staff member called the police.
QR reported the staff followed agency policy. QR added she saw,
and assessed that Staff 1 was preparing to leave before the attack
by Youth A. Staff 1 had gathered her things to leave, and Youth A
was in her way saying, “I have you on my 1”, which QR reported
meant “I’m going to fight you”. Reportedly, Youth A was upset
that she and another youth had been denied a pot to cook, which
she and the other youth knew was against the rules because they
are not allowed to cook after 10:00PM, which was the case. QR
said it was reported by Staff 2 Staff 1 tried to avoid Youth A, but
Youth A followed her down the hall to the office and kicked on the
3

door until it opened; and the assault ensued thereafter. QR
denied conducting any prior investigations on Staff 1.
On 6/30/2025 I interviewed Human Resource Director (HRD) by
telephone. HRD reported information related to Staff 1 not the
alleged incident. She reported Staff 1’s date of hire as 8/16/2021.
Staff 1 was hired in another agency program, transferred to their
residential program, Queen of Angels until being laid off on
10/4/2024; and then rehired on 10/14/2024 in her current position
within this independent living program. HRD described Staff 1 as a
“good employee”. She reported no disciplinary actions or misuse
of agency procedures for Staff 1. She reported that due to this
incident and the allegations, Staff 1 was suspended pending the
investigation.
On 7/11/2025 I interviewed Youth B onsite at the Holy Cross
independent living (IL) home. Youth B said approximately 2-3
weeks ago, Youth A and Staff 1 were fighting each other. She said
Staff 3 was holding Youth A back, but Youth A kept swinging at
Staff 1. Then Staff 1 swung at Youth A’s and hit Youth A's face
area. Youth B reported before the fight Staff 1 had let her cook
past the 9:00PM cut off time; and when Youth A asked to cook
something, Staff 1 did not allow it. Youth B said Youth A got mad,
and wanted to talk about not being allowed to cook, but Staff 1
swung the office door closed on Youth A. Youth B admitted she
did not see the latter and she only heard about that part. She said
the fight took place in the front entrance way of the IL home, which
she reported is away from the prior stated office. Youth B was not
sure how Youth A and Staff 1 got to the entrance location. She
denied ever experiencing a problem with Staff 1 or witnessing one
between Staff 1 and Youth A, or Staff 1 and any other youth prior
to this incident with Youth A. Youth B reported seeing a bruise or
bruises on Staff 1’s face, but did not see any bruises on Youth A
after the incident.
On 7/11/2025 I interviewed Youth C onsite at the Holy Cross
independent living (IL) home. Youth C said approximately 2-3
weeks ago, she had asked to cook something after 9:00pm and
was told no. She reported Youth A went to talk to Staff 1; Staff 1
slammed the door in Youth A’s face and Youth A broke the office
door. Youth C said she was in the hallway during the time the door
was slammed by Staff 1 and broken by Youth A, and She
admitted she did not witness either. She reported hearing Youth
A hitting the door repeatedly and walking away. Youth C said
after Youth A walked away, Staff 1 walked from the dining room
toward the front door, and as Staff 1 was walking Youth A told
4

Staff 1 to stop looking at her. Youth C reported Staff 1 did not
respond to Youth A, and it was all Youth A asking Staff 1 if Staff 1
was going to do something (meaning fight), but Staff 1 kept
walking. Youth C did not see who or when the first punch was
thrown or swung by either Youth A or Staff 1. Youth C said he
saw Staff 3 holding Youth A down and heard Youth A say “stop
hitting me, and that’s how he knew Staff 1 had swung at Youth A.
Youth C was not sure how long or how Staff 3 held Youth A.
Youth C denied seeing any bruises on Youth A after the incident.
On 7/11/2025 I interviewed Youth A face-to-face at her Genesee
County Juvenile Justice Center (GCJC). Youth A reported being
placed in the Holy Cross IL home for two months prior to the
incident with Staff 1, and her being placed at GCJC. Youth A said
she had asked Staff 1 and Staff 3 to take her grocery shopping,
and Staff 1 said no, and “I’m not sure why you are asking me, I
don’t like you.” Youth A did not report why Staff 1 would say that
to her or whether she responded to that remark. She reported
Staff 1 did not like certain youths and would not do things for
them. Youth A reported she had spoken to Youth C and Youth C
had also asked staff to cook food and was told no, due to it being
after 9:00 PM. Youth A did not think it was fair that Youth C was
not allowed to cook after the IL home’s cut off time when the staff
had just allowed Youth B to do so. Youth A said she went to the
office and asked Staff 1 and Staff 2 about that, and Staff 1
slammed the door in her face. Youth A said she went back to the
door and told Staff 1 “When you come out, I need that” which
Youth A said meant “I need to fight you”. Youth A reported she
wanted to fight Staff 1 due to Staff 1 slamming the door in her
face. Youth A did not report being harmed by the door being
slammed. She reported she went back and forth talking to Youth
C, and then she tried talking to Staff 1 again. As she was talking
to Staff 1, Staff 1 put the tip of Staff 1’s finger on Youth A’s
forehead and pushed Youth A’s forehead backward. Youth A then
began to hit and punch Staff 1. Youth A said Staff 1 punched her
and that “we were fighting”.
Youth A said Staff 3 intervened in the fight and was holding her,
which allowed Staff 1 “to get free punches”. Youth A admitted to
holding Staff 1 and biting Staff 1’s breast. Youth A reported Staff
1’s breast was the first thing she could grab, and it was her way of
defending herself, because Staff 1 kept hitting her and Staff 3 was
only holding her. Youth A admitted to hitting Staff 1 with her tablet
and clarified that she did that after Staff 1 pushed her forehead.
She said that was the point they were really fighting. Youth A said
the fight ended when Staff 1 decided not to hit her anymore, and
5

they got up. Youth A did not clarify what they got up from, or
when or how they went down. She said, during the fight the other
girls were screaming at Staff 3 “why are you letting her hit her”.
Youth A did not say which girls were screaming. Youth A was not
sure who called the police, but she reported by the time the police
arrived she had walked away from the area of the fight. Youth A
reported she said, “I just beat the fuck out of Ms. (Staff 1’s last
name) because she hit me”.
Youth A reported Staff 1 had a bruise on the face from her hitting
Staff 1 with the tablet. Youth A said she had a scratch on her face
and chest which are gone now. Youth A reported aside from Staff
2 calling the police on her once, due to Staff 2 thinking she would
do something with Staff 2’s car, she had no disagreements or
problems with any of the staff, including Staff 1, until this incident.
On 7/16/2025 I interviewed Staff 2 by telephone. Staff 2 reported
being a witness to the incident at the beginning. It was at the start
of her 10:00PM shift and Staff 1 was briefing her when Youth C
came and asked to cook. They told Youth C no, because the rule
is the youths do not cook after 9:00PM. Youth A went to Youth C
and Staff 2 heard Youth A say, “This is “bullshit. I bet I can get
food and dishes to cook.” Youth A came to the office door
aggressively and asked Staff 1 “what are you looking at”. Staff 1
tried to close the door, but it could not be completely closed due to
a broken screw in the door. Staff 2 said after Youth A walked
away, Staff 1 announced she was leaving and walked to the front
of the house, to exit that door, but Youth A was there. Youth A
told Staff 1 “I want my 1 with you”, which Staff 2 said was slang for
“I want to fight you”. Staff 2 heard Staff 1 tell Youth A she was not
going to fight because Youth A was her client. Staff 2 said, then
she heard a banging noise, and heard Staff 1 say, “call the police”.
Staff 2 reported the physical incident happened at the other end of
the house; and she did not see the altercation until she checked
the camera. Staff 2 said the camera showed Staff 1 in the
doorway with her arms folded and Youth A talking to Staff 1. Staff
1 walked away, then Youth A hit Staff 1 in the face with an iPad,
and Staff 1 pushed Youth A away. Staff 2 reported after the latter
happened, she did not see anything else. She never saw the two
of them on the floor, and never saw Staff 1 swing on or hit Youth
A. Staff 2 reported she only saw Staff 1 push Youth A backward
to push her away from attacking her. Staff 2 reported knowing
Youth A bit Staff 1’s breast, because Staff 1 said it happened.
6

After the incident Staff 2 denied observing marks or bruises to
Youth A or Youth A reporting any. Staff 2 observed blood on Staff
1’s face. Additionally, Staff 2 who had worked with Staff 1 since
January 2025 reported never observing Staff 1 to hit, or harm a
child, nor to be negative towards Youth A or any child.
On 7/18/2025 I interviewed Staff 3 by telephone. Staff 3 reported
being employed at the IL home since January 2025. She
described the events leading to the altercation similar to Staff 2.
She said she did not witness Youth A coming to the life skills
office or her making remarks to Staff 1. She only observed that on
camera. She saw Staff 1 walking toward the door to leave and
heard Youth A telling Staff 1 to come outside so they could fight
and heard Youth A say, “I’ll beat your ass”. Staff 3 said Staff 1 did
not engage with Youth A and Staff 1 kept walking away from
Youth A. Staff 3 then heard a noise and Staff 1 yelling “help,
help”. Staff 3 arrived and saw Staff 1 trying to pull away from
Youth A and Youth A was hitting Staff 1. Staff 3 said she put her
body in between Youth A and Staff 1, trying to pull them apart, but
Youth A was holding tight onto Staff 1’s bag, or shirt, or
something. Staff 3 was not sure what exactly Youth A was holding
onto on Staff 1, but Staff 3 said it was not a body part. Staff 3 said
Youth A was throwing punches and she was surprised she did not
get hit. Staff 3 said Staff 1 was jerking around and trying to free
herself from Youth A’s grip, but Staff 1 could not. Nor could Staff 3
free Staff 1. She said Staff 1 had to raise her hand and hit Youth A
to free herself from Youth A. Staff 3 did not see where Staff 1’s
hand landed on Youth A’s body.
After the incident Staff 3 denied observing marks or bruises to
Youth A or Youth A reporting any. Staff 3 observed Staff 1 to
have a cut under the left eye that was bleeding, a scratch on the
right side of her neck and a bruise on her breast where Youth A bit
her. Staff 3 reported knowing about the bruise to Staff 1’s breast
because the male police who came out on this incident asked her
to look at Staff 1’s breast, so he could report on it. Additionally,
Staff 3 who had worked with Staff 1 for over five years reported
never observing Staff 1 to hit, or harm a child, nor to be negative
towards Youth A or any child. Staff 3 added that what happened to
Staff 1 could have happened to any one of them, because Youth
A, in the last several weeks before her departure from the IL home
had become combative and antagonist with staff and the other
youths; and tried to pick a fight.
On 7/18/205, I interviewed Staff 1 on video via TEAMS. Staff 1
reported working for the agency in other agency program since
7

September 2021. She has worked as a Youth Recovery Worker in
this IL home since November 2024.
Staff 1 reported after she and Staff 3 advised Youth A that Youth
A was not allowed to cook due to the kitchen being closed; Youth
A told them she hoped they would die driving home and walked
away. Staff 1 left and went to the staff office and was briefing Staff
2 who had come on shift, when another youth came and made the
same request to cook as Youth A had. That youth, who Staff 1 did
not name, was also told no, and the youth left cursing. Staff 1
said Youth A came to the staff’s office and told her to “Get the fuck
out her way”; and Staff 1 closed the office door. Staff 1 said she
closed the door hard because she knew if she had not, Youth A
would try to open it, because Youth A was yelling and cursing at
her. Staff 1 said she waited for Youth A to leave, and after she did
not hear Youth A outside the door, she decided to leave to go to
her car. Staff 1 reported as she got to the front entrance way,
Youth A was there. Youth A told her to come outside and “You
need to run me that” which meant, come fight me. Staff 1 said
she told Youth A she was not fighting her. Staff 1 folded her arms
and was walking back. Youth A was yelling, cursing and trying to
get Staff 1 to feed into her behavior. Staff 1 said she turned
around and told Youth A that she was not going to fight her
because she was a child. Staff 1 reported it was at that point that
Youth A hit her in the face with the edge of an iPad. Staff 1
reported she went to grab Youth A upper arm or wrist to put her in
a bent down position so that Youth A would not be able to move.
Staff 1 said the two of them were both bent over, and she was
trying to restrict Youth A’s movement so Youth A would not hit her
again. Staff 1 was also yelling out for help; and then Youth A bit
Staff 1 on the left breast. Staff 1 said she had to squeeze Youth
A’s cheeks together to get Youth A to release her breast. Staff 1
reported the squeezing of the youth’s cheek is what she was
taught to do in case of a being bitten by a client. Staff 1 reported
when Youth A released her breast, she and Youth A both came up
to the upright position; and Youth A hit her in the face with the
iPad again. Staff 1 reported at this point Staff 3 forced herself in
between her and Youth A. Staff 1 reported she still could not
move to free herself from Youth A, because Youth A was holding
on to her work bag or shirt. During this time Youth A was spitting,
and it was getting in Staff 1’s face and she assumed also onto
Staff 3. Staff 1 said she had to hit Youth A with an open hand on
the top of Youth A’s head to get Youth A to release her. Staff 1
said she used her left hand, and it was not with great force. As
soon she hit Youth A, Youth A said, “You hit me, you’re going to
jail.” Youth A was also yelling about how she had messed up
8

Staff 1’s face and the other girls were also yelling and hollering.
Staff 1 did not report what the other youths were yelling, or who
those youths were, because she was afraid, so she walked toward
the door and left. Staff 1 said her face was bloody and Youth A
was yelling “I beat your ass.” Youth A did not have any marks or
bruises that Staff 1 saw.
Staff 1 said a few days before this incident Youth A was saying
she was going to beat someone up. Staff 1 reported Youth A’s
behavior had always been loud, instigating, dramatic and
aggressive; where it was always hard to talk with her, but Staff 1
was always cordial with Youth A. Staff 1 denied that she was
angry during the incident. She said she was in disbelief, shock,
and hurt. She said she had never had a youth to blatantly
disregard her, and she never thought she would get attacked.
Staff 1 also denied that she was trying to restrain Youth A. She
stated, “I do not know one person restraint.” She said she was
trying not to be hit again. She was trying to hold Youth A until help
came. She stated her action of hitting the top of Youth A’s head
was a last resort to try to free herself from Youth A’s hold on her.
She added that the agency has a no restraint policy. They are CPI
(Crisis Prevention Intervention),trained and they are not permitted
to restrain. They are only allowed to hold a child whom they can’t
de-escalate and in this situation it was an assault on her. Staff 1
reported she did not leave after she was hit the first time, because
she knew Youth A would still attack her as she walked away. That
is what Youth A had done in another situation when she had to
break up a fight between Youth A and a peer in March or April of
this year. In that situation Staff 1 reported Youth A put hands
around her neck as Youth A tried to move Staff 1 away in Youth
A’s attempt to go after the peer. Staff 1 reported at no time did
she try to or want to harm Youth A; she was trying to stop the
assault.
Document Review:
Video footage for the 6/15/2025 incident consisting of two clips of
camera footage, from Compliance Manager (CM):
• The first camera clip from the dining room area showed:
o A youth identified as Youth A walked into the dining
area carrying an electronic device identified by CM
as an iPad. Youth A went into what appeared to be
a kitchen; then she exited quickly back through the
door/hallway area she had entered from.
9

o Two youths who were not named, entered the dining
area after Youth A had exited and went into the
kitchen.
o A few seconds later an adult, identified as Staff 1,
stepped backward with her arms folded toward the
opened door/hallway that Youth A had entered the
dining room through. As Staff 1 stepped back, Youth
A hit her in the face with the iPad. Staff 1 appeared
to reach out for or toward Youth A; and they are no
longer on camera.
o Youths, who had entered the dining area and kitchen
after Youth A and who were not named ran out to
the hallway area, and they too went off camera. At
the very end of this camera clip, Staff 1 walked back
into the dining area, and then the camera footage
ended.
• The second camera clip from the living room area showed:
o Staff 1 bent over Youth A, and they stumbled
backward and about. Then another person, identified
as Staff 3 appeared, backed in between Staff 1 and
Youth A, and they then struggled around.
o Two youths who reportedly were Youth B and Youth
C looked on.
o Staff 1 appeared to reach her arm or hand over
towards Youth A; and the incident ended. Staff 1
walked away.
Document Review
Youth A MiSACWIS file that showed:
o Youth A (18) is MCI (Michigan Children Institute) Ward and
has been in care since 2021. She was previously adopted.
o She is diagnosed with Posttraumatic stress disorder;
oppositional defiant disorder; other specific disruptive
impulse control & conduct disorder; disruptive mood
dysregulation disorder.
o She was placed at the Holy Cross IL home on 4/7/2025.
Employment documents for Staff 1 which showed:
o Proof of her behavior management training on 4/2/2025.
o Her last performance evaluation dated 3/18/2025, that
showed she meets expectations in all areas, except stress
management; and attendance and punctuality which were
documented as need improvement.
o An HR email statement that there were no records in her
personnel file indicating any disciplinary actions, policy
10

violations, or misuse of procedures during her initial term of
employment. Her file reflected consistent compliance with
agency policies and expectations through the time she was
with the agency from 8/16/2021 until current.
o A 6/19/25 letter to Staff 1 indicating she was placed on
administrative suspension pending an investigation.
An Incident report dated 6/15/2025 that was consistent with Staff
1’s interview.
Analysis Based on interviews and documents reviewed the information
does not support Staff 1 is of unresponsible character or
unsuitable and able to meet the needs of children and families
served by the agency. Staff 1 reported she hit Youth A on the
head to try and get Youth A to release her hold on Staff 1.
Although this is not condoned, the information received does not
demonstrate Staff 1 intentionally tried to hurt or deliberately inflict
bodily harm on Youth A.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12503 Policy and procedures.
Section (1) An agency shall have and follow written policies and
Description procedures for the independent living services provided.
Violation Additional Findings
Type
Allegation Staff 1 did not follow the facility’s behavior management policy.
Interviews:
Investigation During my telephone interview with QR on 6/30/2025, she
reported Staff 1 admitted to hitting Youth A on the head; and Staff
1 demonstrated how she hit Youth A.
During my telephone interview with Staff 3 on 7/18/25, Staff 3
reported Staff 1 hit Youth A, but she did not see where Staff 1’s hit
landed on Youth A.
During my TEAMS interview with Staff 1 on 7/18/25, Staff 1
reported she went to grab Youth A upper arm or wrist to put her in
a bent down position so that Youth A would not be able to move.
Staff 1 said the two of them were both bent over, and she was
trying to restrict Youth A’s movement so Youth A would not hit her
again. Staff 1 denied she was trying to restrain Youth A. She
stated, “I do not know one person restraint.” She said she was
trying not to be hit again. She was trying to hold Youth A until help
came. She added the agency has a no restraint policy. They are
CPI (Crisis Prevention Intervention) trained, and they are not
permitted to restrain. They are only allowed to hold a child whom
they can’t de-escalate, and, in this situation, it was an assault on
11

her. During another part of the incident, Staff 1 said she had to hit
Youth A with an open hand on the top of Youth A’s head to get
Youth A to release her. Staff 1 said she used her left hand, and it
was not with great force.
Video Review:
Video footage for the 6/15/2025 is not clear enough to show Staff
1 hitting Youth A on the head or putting her in a type of restraint
hold.
Document Review:
Copy of Holy Cross’s behavior management policy & procedure
which indicated:
o It is the policy of Holy Cross Services (HCS) that all
participants have the right to receive treatment services
free from the threat of physical management in which
participants are taken or held on the floor, chemical
restraint, seclusion, and any form of retaliatory
punishment.
o HCS practices a restraint-free behavior management
program throughout all program sites. In extreme cases,
emergency personnel will be contacted to intervene, if
such intervention is warranted by the actions of the
participant.
o HCS staff are provided with in-depth orientation and
training in the proper and safe use of behavior
management techniques, including but not limited to non-
physical de-escalation and emergency intervention
techniques.
An Incident Report dated 6/15/2025 was consistent with Staff 1’s
statement that she hit Youth on the head with an open
hand, to free herself from Youth A.
Analysis Based on interviews and documents reviewed, Staff 1 admitted to
holding Youth A in some type of restraint position and admitted to
hitting Youth A on the top of the head with an open hand. Based
on these actions by Staff 1, she did not follow the agency’s policy
of non-physical behavioral management.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
• Restraints are not appropriate procedures for IL youth.
• Staff 1 noted “They are only allowed to hold a child whom
they can’t de-escalate”, which conflicts with the facility’s no-
restraint policy. Clarification should be provided for staff to
ensure they understand the policy and definitions of
12

restraint. The definition of restraint is the application of
physical force, without the use of a device, which restricts
